intro: Critesion hystrix, commonly known as the spiny hound's tail, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features distinctive spiny bracts that give it its common name and protect its small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Critesion hystrix thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
